output.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /*****************************************************************************
00002 
00003   Description: Routines for writing error messages, warning messages and the
00004                statements written by PrintLabel and WriteLabel.
00005  
00006   Author:  Randy Davis, University of Colorado LASP
00007 
00008   Creation Date:  25 August 1990
00009   Last Modified:  18 May, 1991
00010 
00011   History:
00012 
00013     Creation - This set of routines was introduced in Version 2 of the
00014     ODLC library.  These routines are 'standard' versions of output
00015     routines for the error and warning messages generated while reading
00016     and parsing a label and for the statements written by PrintLabel and
00017     WriteLabel.  The error and warning routines put out messages to the
00018     'stderr' file.  ODLPrintStmt writes to the 'stdout' file.  ODLWriteStmt
00019     writes to a file specified by the first argument to the routine.  These
00020     routines were introduced in the Version 2.0 release of the ODLC library.
00021     Software developers using the ODLC package can customize their
00022     program's output by providing their own versions of these routines.
00023     For example, user-provided versions of the print routines might be
00024     used to place output into special windows on a workstation screen.
00025 
00026     Version 2.1 - 14 March 1991 - R. Davis, U. of Colorado LASP
00027       a) Defined the ODLerror_count and ODLwarning_count global variables in
00028          this module rather than in the file with the parser action routines.
00029          Also added a new global variable, ODLlinenumber_flag, to make the
00030          reporting of line numbers in error/warning messages optional.  This
00031          allows the error routines to be used for other purposes than
00032          printing and writing messages from the label parser.
00033       b) Added routine ODLPrintInfo to print information messages.
00034 
00035     Version 2.2 - 18 May 1991 - M. DeMore, Jet Propulsion Laboratory
00036        Removed include statements that were Unix specific and placed them
00037        in odldef.h. Added include file odlinter.h.
00038 
00039        19-Jun-1995  ANS Changed the ODLPrintError, PrintWarning and
00040                 Print Info functions to write the ouput to
00041                 the logfile
00042 
00043 *****************************************************************************/
00044 
00045 #include "odldef.h"
00046 #include "odlinter.h"
00047 /*#include "PGS_tk.h"
00048 #include "PGS_SMF.h"*/
00049 
00050 /* The following external variable is defined and set by the lexical
00051    analyzer and is used here in error reporting.                            */
00052 
00053 extern int yylineno;       /* Current source line number                    */
00054 
00055 /* The following external variables are defined here and used in other
00056    modules */
00057 
00058 int  ODLerror_count;       /* Cumulative count of errors                    */
00059 int  ODLwarning_count;     /* Cumulative count of warnings                  */
00060 int  ODLlinenumber_flag;   /* TRUE if line number to be reported in message */
00061 
00062 
00063 
00064 /*****************************************************************************
00065 
00066   Routine: ODLPrintError
00067  
00068   Description: Prints a message reporting an error detected during the
00069                parsing of an ODL label.
00070  
00071   Input:
00072           error_msg - Character string with text of error message.
00073  
00074   Output: The error message string is printed to the stderr output file.
00075 
00076 *****************************************************************************/
00077 
00078 #ifndef EOSDIS          /* GMS: if we are the EOSDIS project, the 
00079                  * output has been redirected to IK_Syslog */
00080 void ODLPrintError (
00081      char  error_msg[])
00082 {
00083     char errHead[30];
00084 /*
00085   if (ODLlinenumber_flag)
00086     {
00087 */
00088       /* Include the line number in the error message */
00089 /*
00090       fprintf (stderr, "**Error at line %d:\n", yylineno);
00091     }
00092   else
00093     {
00094       fprintf (stderr, "**Error:");
00095     }
00096 */
00097   /* Put out the error message text and increment the error count */
00098 
00099 /*  fprintf (stderr, "  %s\n", error_msg);
00100 */
00101 
00102     if(ODLlinenumber_flag) sprintf(errHead, "ODL Error at line %d:", yylineno);
00103     else
00104     {
00105         sprintf(errHead, "ODL Error:");
00106         
00107     }
00108     /*(void) PGS_SMF_SetDynamicMsg(PGSMET_E_ODL_ERROR, error_msg, errHead);*/
00109     printf("%s\n",errHead);
00110   ODLerror_count++;
00111 
00112   return;
00113 }
00114 
00115 
00116 
00117 /*****************************************************************************
00118 
00119   Routine: ODLPrintWarning
00120  
00121   Description: Prints a message to warn of a non-fatal problem detected
00122                during the parsing of an ODL label.
00123  
00124   Input:
00125           warning - Character string with text of warning message.
00126  
00127   Output: The warning message string is printed to the stderr output file.
00128 
00129 *****************************************************************************/
00130 
00131 void ODLPrintWarning (
00132      char warning[])
00133 {
00134     char warningHead[30];
00135 /*
00136   if (ODLlinenumber_flag)
00137     {
00138 */
00139       /* Include the line number in the warning message */
00140 /*
00141       fprintf (stderr, "**Warning at line %d:\n", yylineno);
00142     }
00143   else
00144     {
00145       fprintf (stderr, "**Warning:");
00146     }
00147 */
00148 
00149   /* Put out the warning message text and increment the warning count */
00150 /*
00151 
00152   fprintf (stderr, "  %s\n", warning);
00153 */
00154     if(ODLlinenumber_flag) sprintf(warningHead, "ODL Warning at line %d:", yylineno);
00155         else
00156         {
00157                 sprintf(warningHead, "ODL Warning:");
00158 
00159         }
00160         /* (void) PGS_SMF_SetDynamicMsg(PGSMET_W_ODL_WARNING, warning, warningHead); */
00161   printf("%s\n",warningHead);
00162   ODLwarning_count++;
00163 
00164   return;
00165 }
00166 
00167 
00168 
00169 /*****************************************************************************
00170 
00171   Routine: ODLPrintInfo
00172  
00173   Description: Prints a message to inform the user of a situation that
00174                is important but not an error or warning.
00175  
00176   Input:
00177           info_message - Character string with text of the message.
00178  
00179   Output: The message string is printed to the stdout output file.
00180 
00181 *****************************************************************************/
00182 
00183 
00184 void ODLPrintInfo (
00185      char info_message[])
00186 {
00187 
00188   /* Put out the message text */
00189 
00190    fprintf (stdout, "**Note: %s\n", info_message); 
00191 
00192   /*(void) PGS_SMF_SetDynamicMsg(PGSMET_M_ODL_INFO, info_message, "Note: ");*/
00193 
00194   return;
00195 }
00196 
00197 #endif
00198 
00199 
00200 
00201 /*****************************************************************************
00202 
00203   Routine: ODLPrintStmt
00204  
00205   Description: Prints an ODL statement.
00206  
00207   Input:
00208           stmt - Character string with statement to be printed.
00209  
00210   Output: The statement is printed to the stdout output file.
00211 
00212 *****************************************************************************/
00213 
00214 
00215 void ODLPrintStmt (
00216      char statement[])
00217 {
00218 
00219   fputs (statement, stdout);
00220 
00221   return;
00222 }
00223 
00224 
00225 
00226 
00227 /*****************************************************************************
00228 
00229   Routine: ODLWriteStmt
00230  
00231   Description: Writes an ODL label statement to the specified file.
00232  
00233   Input:
00234           output_file - Pointer to file to which statement is to be written.
00235           statement - Character string with statement to be written.
00236  
00237   Output: The statement is printed to the output file.
00238 
00239 *****************************************************************************/
00240 
00241 
00242 void ODLWriteStmt (
00243      FILE *output_file,
00244      char  statement[])
00245 {
00246 
00247   fputs (statement, output_file);
00248   /* len =strlen(statement);
00249 fwrite(output_file, len, statement);
00250 */
00251   return;
00252 }
